meaning: lord, chief, master, main thing, principal

onyomiExamples.meaning: (one's) master, Lord, the main thing, the majority, the primary concern
head (of a household), proprietor (of a store), proprietress, landlord, landlady, one's husband, (one's) employer, (one's) master, host, hostess
honorific (or familiar) suffix used after a name
(one's) master, Lord, the main thing, the majority, the primary concern
master and servant, lord and retainer, employer and employee

kunyomiExamples.meaning: head (of a household, etc.), leader, master, owner, proprietor, proprietress, subject (of a rumour, etc.), doer (of a deed), guardian spirit (e.g. long-resident beast, usu. with mystical powers), long-time resident (or employee, etc.), husband, you
owner of a horse (esp. racehorse), registered owner (of a racehorse)
chief, main, principal, important, main secondary or supporting role (in kyogen)
head (of a household), proprietor (of a store), proprietress, landlord, landlady, master (of a servant), entertaining someone as one's guest
